message.content: This question requires understanding of chemical changes and their causes. When a thing is set on fire, it undergoes a chemical change. The heat from the fire causes the molecules in the object to break apart and rearrange, resulting in a new substance with different properties. Option (A) is unrelated to chemical changes. Option (B) is unrelated to any type of change. Option (D) is unrelated as looking at something through a mirror does not cause a chemical change.

Option (D) is related to the reflection of light and has no impact on the chemical properties of an object.
